intro: Cryptantha micrantha var. genuina, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cryptantha micrantha var. genuina is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
